metadata.title: Our Values and Behaviours Framework

capabilities.description: Appreciative: Notices and recognises others’ efforts. Goes out of their way to make others feel valued and heard. Praises behaviours over outcomes.
Professional: Sets boundaries. Calm, patient, reassuring and puts people at ease. Takes responsibility and calls out when others are not.
Fair: Ensure equity among staff and patients. Treats people as an equal and valued individual. Protects privacy and dignity of others.
Teamwork: Inclusive. Gets to know people, involves, encourages contributions. Connects people so they feel involved. Cooperates without hierarchy.
Supportive: Is attentive to other people’s needs and feelings. Willing and helpful. Offers help when needed or finds someone else who can help.
Innovative: High standards. Always looking to learn, and for better ways to do things. Is open and flexible to change and encourages this in others.
Shows empathy: Takes the time to understand and listen to issues or concerns. Puts themselves in other people’s shoes. Adjusts to different people.
Kind: Notices and takes action when people are in pain, stressed or upset. Gives feedback when necessary in a safe, non-judgmental way.
Listens: Takes time to make others feel listened to and supported. Values different perspectives. Takes other people’s views into consideration.
Honest: Keeps people informed. Clear, open and honest communication. Ensures people get information in ways that they can understand.
Optimistic: Shows a positive attitude when problem solving. Optimistic about what people can achieve. Encourages, not deterred by setbacks.
Welcoming: Is approachable, polite, cheerful. Introduces themselves with ‘hello my name is…’ smiles and makes eye contact, when appropriate.
